resources.string: Do not have account? Register here!
What is the purpose of this questionnaire?

**You will need to complete a questionnaire confidentially each time you donate blood. Your answers will give us a good idea about your state of health, it is very important for us all our blood donors to be safe. In addition it can help you to have an opinion about your health.

**Based on the answers we may ask you not to donate blood. This can happen to otherwise healthy people, even a small cold can be a cause of exclusion. In order to avoid an unsuccessful blood donation attempt, check the list that does not allow you to donate blood. "Download" the questionnaire and contact us if you have any questions.
What happens after you donate blood?

After the blood donation is completed, all blood units are transferred to laboratories for testing and processing. This should be done as soon as possible after the blood sampling is completed to ensure processing and preparation for as long as possible. as many blood products as possible.

After the end of the tests, special labels are placed on the blood units that indicate the results of the tests and the blood type (the procedure is called marking) as well as the expiration limit and then the units are placed in the refrigerators ready to be distributed to anyone in need. Conditions vary depending on the product.
Would you like to donate blood but have not yet decided?

Research has shown that while 75% of the population may need a blood transfusion at some point in their lives, only a small percentage of about 1.5% are blood donors. If you are healthy, chances are you can donate blood and thus help the numbers come out. With just one blood donation you can save three lives, without costing you anything.

# You are between 18 and 65 years old. 
 
 # You weigh over 50kg. 
 
# You are healthy. 
 
 # You have a safe lifestyle. 
 
 # You are determined to help others.
